entry.title: Kubrick stare (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Kubrick stare (example pictured) can be "invasive" and "troubling"?

entry.title: Chloë Farro (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chloë Farro, María Sara Grippoli, Edda Hannesdóttir, Viren Nettasinghe, Oyuntsetsegiin Yesügen, and Lê Đức Phát are flagbearers at today's Olympic opening ceremony?

entry.title: a Tennessee TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that silver dimes kept a Tennessee TV station on the air?

entry.title: Oliver Golden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that agronomist Oliver Golden remained in the Soviet Union after his delegation of cotton experts returned to the United States?

entry.title: Grand Army Plaza (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Guinness World Record holder for the world's largest menorah, in Manhattan's Grand Army Plaza, is smaller than a menorah in Brooklyn's Grand Army Plaza?

entry.title: Camil Doua (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Olympic swimmer Camil Doua represents a country in which "the only existing swimming pools are those in hotels"?

entry.title: a rare circumstance (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that there is a rare circumstance in which Jewish soldiers are allowed to abandon kosher dietary laws?

entry.title: Alison McGregor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that physiotherapist Alison McGregor was one of the Olympic flame torchbearers from Imperial College London in the build-up to the London Olympic Games in 2012?

entry.title: gay furry hackers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that NATO was once targeted by a group of "gay furry hackers"?
